**Version Number:**
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction  (Repro only in Android Emulator)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @hungvu193 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): #[Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1768661857212849)

## Action Performed:
1. Login with any account
2. Go to any page
3. Press device back button
4. App is closed instead of going back previous page
## Expected Result:
It should go back to previous page instead of closing the App.
## Actual Result:
App is closed after pressing back button
## Workaround:
Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround?

## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [x] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] Windows: Chrome
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

title: [$375] [Onyx] Investigate Reassure stability on CI

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C01GTK53T8Q/p1769093035654139?thread_ts=1768666683.491279&cid=C01GTK53T8Q). Looks like Reassure started to fail again on CI. Here's a [example PR](https://github.com/Expensify/react-native-onyx/pull/722). From our initial tests this flakiness is present on CI but not locally. We suspect that it started to fail after [this PR](https://github.com/Expensify/react-native-onyx/pull/689) was merged. I think we shouldn't focus on reverting changes of the PR but instead try to understand why this is happening and come up with a solution stabilize Reassure again on Onyx.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.7-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/76595 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsiodjosjdnisojso@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to self DM. 3. Go offline. 4. Create a scan expense. 5. Click Submit it to someone. 6. Enter merchant > Next. ## Expected Result: Confirm page will not show Amount field because receipt is scanning. ## Actual Result: Confirm page shows Amount field with 0.00 amount when receipt is scanning. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aa2a8ebd-3b7a-4b87-ba7a-f754d1a6febd [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
## Background Coming from [this convo](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1768875279554969), we'd like to add a `Remove` button to the `Track distance` > `Map` flow, specifically on the page where you enter an individual address. Both on web and mobile. ## Details This is exactly where we want to add the `Remove` button, on the second screen below: cc @Expensify/design
